documentType: Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Report
summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services report evaluating Jeffrey Epstein's competency to proceed with a disciplinary process following an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation. The report, dated July 30, 2019, concludes Epstein was competent, references a prior suicide risk assessment, and notes uncertainty about how marks on his neck were obtained.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the psychological evaluation to determine competency for a disciplinary process related to an incident report for tattooing or self-mutilation.

persons.name: Proto
persons.context: Referred inmate Epstein for the competency evaluation regarding the disciplinary process.

persons.name: Dr. M
persons.context: Conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein on July 9, 2019, and authored a Diagnostic and Care Level Formulation Note.

persons.name: PsyD
persons.context: The author of this competency evaluation report, conducted the clinical interview and assessment on July 23 and 30, 2019.

connections.description: Unit Manager Proto referred inmate Epstein for the competency evaluation.
Dr. M conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment and diagnostic evaluation on Epstein.
PsyD evaluated Epstein's competency for the disciplinary process and conducted a clinical interview.

events.title: Epstein Charged with Tattooing/Self-Mutilation
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was charged with a Bureau of Prisons code violation (228) for tattooing or self-mutilation, assigned incident report number 3282555.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment by Dr. M
events.description: Dr. M conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein, where Epstein denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.

events.title: Suicide Risk Assessment by PsyD
events.description: PsyD conducted a Suicide Risk Assessment on Epstein, noting it was unclear if Epstein or someone else placed a string around his neck.

events.title: Competency Evaluation Completed
events.description: PsyD completed the evaluation and determined Jeffrey Epstein was competent to proceed with the disciplinary process.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was charged in prison with 'Tattooing or Self-Mutilation' (incident report 3282555).
A psychological evaluation on July 30, 2019, found Epstein competent to proceed with the disciplinary process for this charge.
A Suicide Risk Assessment on July 23, 2019, noted it was 'unclear' if Epstein or someone else had placed a string around his neck, creating marks.
Epstein, according to a July 9, 2019 assessment, denied any history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, or self-injurious behavior.
The document is a formal Bureau of Prisons institutional report generated days before Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.
